intro: Bejaria resinosa, commonly known as the resinous bejaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stem and glandular hairs. The plant produces a sticky resin, which is one of its distinguishing features. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, textured surface. Bejaria resinosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in warm climates.
